tweet: Wishing a Happy Mother’s Day to all mothers, grandmothers, Godmothers, aunts, and mother figures. We honor and appreciate you today and every day.

May is Mental Health Month and taking care of our mental health is important during these difficult times. Don’t be afraid to reach out for help if you or someone you know needs it. We can get through this together. Learn more at https://t.co/PFNb0ynOK3 #NotAlone #MHM

#COVID19 has made the health disparities that have long existed in America all the more apparent. That’s why I’m standing with @CAPAC @HispanicCaucus @OfficialCBC during #MinorityHealthMonth to take on the structural inequalities that contribute to these disparities. #NMHM2020

Important information for my constituents: @La_Appleseed recently issued their COVID-19 bulletin on free Civil Legal Aid services available to you and others in need throughout the state. Please contact their hotline for further details at 1-844-244-7871. https://t.co/amdswm3Wmm

I wish all those celebrating today a happy and healthy Easter. We may be in difficult times, but better days are coming. On this Resurrection Sunday, let us remember and practice principles of faith, mercy, and peace towards each other. Our resilience depends on it. #Easter2020
The @IRSnews recently launched an online portal for non-filers to enter direct deposit information to receive Economic Impact Payments here: https://t.co/niC1k9hHxk
I’m proud of @Allstate for putting money back into the pockets of their Louisiana customers and others nationwide. https://t.co/1cZof2jZ9h

Today I sent a letter to @SpeakerPelosi calling on Congress to create a Select Committee to investigate the disproportionate percentage of minority mortality from COVID-19. In Louisiana, 70% of COVID-19 related deaths are from the Black community. We must act soon to save lives. https://t.co/Q8Bx4zIk60
I’d like to wish a happy and healthy Passover to all those celebrating! #Passover2020

It’s always the right time to do the right thing. That’s why my colleagues and I sent a letter to @SBAgov and @USTreasury expressing our opposition to recent changes to the Paycheck Protection Program. Read my statement here: https://t.co/bncCAww1Rp

New Orleans has truly lost a piece of our heart that we will never be able to fill. I mourn the loss of our beloved jazz icon, Ellis Marsalis Jr. His music will forever fill our hearts with joy and our streets with melodies. May his soul rest in paradise. https://t.co/jyZuLenFwK

This #CensusDay, I urge my constituents to participate. Now more than ever, representation truly matters. By taking just a few short minutes, you’ll be able to influence your community for years to come. Visit https://t.co/jFSYzq90jW to complete the form online. #2020Census

To Louisiana Small Business Owners, please refer to this chart comparing the Paycheck Protection Program to the Economic Injury Disaster Loan. Reach out to my office for additional assistance or if you have any questions. https://t.co/f2In80x2Fo

Today, the House passed the CARES Act in response to the Coronavirus pandemic. For my constituents in Louisiana’s Second Congressional district, I have resources for you and am here for you. Please read and share my COVID-19 Critical Recovery Report: https://t.co/f52C3LmA1S

As we work through the uncertainty that the spread of coronavirus has brought us, I’ll continue to advocate for adequate resources for all of my constituents. Please subscribe to my e-newsletter to receive up-to-date information as the situation develops: https://t.co/ZQY8SgrHzs

The U.S. Small Business Disaster Loan Assistance application is now live. I urge my constituents in need to apply now. Visit the website at https://t.co/JqY62XE1ZN and view some useful frequently asked questions. https://t.co/kSz294hQca

Yesterday, I held a tele-town hall for my constituents on COVID-19. While I was glad to address their questions, it became clear to me how much our seniors depend on us during this challenging time. I’m calling on the federal government to expand the Meals on Wheels program.

While Louisiana is still one of 16 states without a confirmed case of the Coronavirus, it’s still in good form to wash your hands thoroughly for at least 20 seconds. Any one of these recommended Nola songs will help keep you upbeat in the process. https://t.co/nFlarDP6ys

Thank you to @TulaneLaw for featuring my work on the CROWN Act with fellow alum @ProfessorDWendy. We must continue to move forward on the fight against discrimination of Afro textured hair. https://t.co/zH5vienx2E #CROWNAct #BHM2020 #TulaneLaw

Thank you to all those who joined my Census jobs fair in Baton Rouge today. If you are in New Orleans tomorrow, please be sure to join us to meet with @uscensusbureau recruiters and learn about 2020 Census jobs. We need to make sure everyone gets counted. #Census2020 https://t.co/T6FLibeh0N
May Katherine Johnson rest in power. We are all better for her contributions to NASA and her role as a trailblazing African-American woman in STEM. https://t.co/mjSlKuSuhE

Congratulations to @MatthewACherry, @KarenRToliver, and the entire Hair Love team on your Oscar win! Thank you for your work on representation and promoting the CROWN Act. I’m so proud to have authored legislation on a federal level to end discrimination against Black hair. https://t.co/NNYsMTcwS6
This is a damn shame and this President wants Billions to build a wall! We can to better.  https://t.co/2yLeWbIj8K

This #BlackHistoryMonth, let us to honor the leaders and trailblazers who came before us by recommitting ourselves to the fight for equality and justice. I’m proud to walk in the footsteps of so many of them from Louisiana, as well as from inside the halls of Congress. #BHM2020

I join the world in grief with the heartbreaking passing of NBA legend Kobe Bryant and his daughter, Gianna. I send my condolences to his wife, family, and fans during this tragic time. This is a very sad reminder to keep your loved ones close because tomorrow is not promised.

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. lived his life in service to others through the practice of peace and social justice. Let not only today, but everyday, serve as a reminder to honor him by following the footsteps of one of our world’s foremost visionaries. #MLK2020 https://t.co/yLevl5lhad
She sure is, my friend. What a historic week it’s been for New Orleans and all of Louisiana! https://t.co/8SQo7yN44J
Congratulations to our very own @LSUfootball Tigers for their National Championship victory! You make our district and all of Louisiana proud. #GeauxTigers

New Orleans has lost a legend with the passing of 5th Ward Weebie, and I’m sad to have lost my dear friend. May Jerome Cosey’s soul rest in power. I send my support and prayers to his family and friends during this difficult time. 
https://t.co/tdfo8GRt6N

Yesterday I sent a letter to @EPA Regional Administrator Ken McQueen and @LOUISIANA_DEQ Secretary Chuck Carr Brown addressing the new air quality testing system in communities surrounding the Denka Performance Elastomer plant. https://t.co/z7bqJCOfiF
You’re welcome! https://t.co/RPFj3k0cfC
You’re welcome! https://t.co/NvqxYNzhDz

American students deserve an equal opportunity to succeed. My colleagues and I worked hard to secure critical funding for #HBCUs and other #MSIs to ensure our nation’s students of color will have pathways toward success. #FUTUREAct

I’m grateful to @TheSFIA for their consistent and long-standing support of the PHIT Act. Leading a healthy and active lifestyle should be accessible and attainable for all people. I’m proud to be the 100th cosponsor. #PASSPHIT https://t.co/e6MoywPmSj
The time has come to be the winter soldier. The time has come to show the courage of Esther.
Thank you for your visit! https://t.co/FMSh8Qo9w5
Wow. cc: @RepJeffries https://t.co/ZpugejU0M3

Last week, I was interviewed by @cenkuygur of @TheYoungTurks on Black Indentity Extremists. I applaud @kenklippenstein and The Young Turks for their work shedding light on this issue. https://t.co/p0M6FaSnMV

I applaud @Tulane for honoring African-American trailblazers Deidre Dumas Labat and Reynold T. Décou with the new Décou-Labat Residences. They paved the way for me to enter the law school, as well as  countless other students of color who came after them. https://t.co/ivYdqU5Y3R

I’m proud to honor #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth. Louisiana is home to four federally recognized tribes, and Native American heritage has greatly influenced Louisiana culture. Native American history is American history we should all celebrate.

On Veterans Day today, we honor the sacrifices of the courageous men and women who have fought for our comfort and freedom with endless gratitude. Though we can never repay you, we earnestly thank you for your service! #VeteransDay

My sincere condolences and prayers go out to the family and friends of notable author and Louisiana native Ernest Gaines. His literary works were powerful, and his contributions were immeasurable. May he rest in power. https://t.co/tAxTa4DqtD

Today’s announcement from the @NCAA was a monumental step forward in advancing the interest of student-athletes. Im glad the Student-Athlete Equity Act, a bill I introduced with @RepMarkWalker, played an integral role in this conversation. https://t.co/zKUFMbKeHB

Today the world lost a political pioneer and tireless champion for justice. I lost my treasured colleague and friend. A principled and passionate leader, Elijah Cummings dedicated his life to public service. May he rest in power and his legacy last a lifetime. https://t.co/iBM867OKJs

Happy #IndigenousPeoplesDay to the Native American community whose strength, heritage, and stories have allowed America to thrive. As we recognize the grave injustices endured throughout history, we also thank you for your contributions to society and honor your resilience.

Today is World Mental Health Day. Let us lend a helping hand to all those who may suffer in silence and continue to work to break the stigma around it. As we all know, health is wealth and access to mental health care should be readily available for everyone in need.

Congratulations to New Orleans native Albert Woodfox for his book, Solitary, being on this year’s @NewYorker National Book Awards list. Albert’s fight for freedom was long fought and earned. I’m proud to know him and have worked with him along his journey. https://t.co/eXTArV5TOJ

Cokie Roberts was one of a kind. Her trailblazing work and brilliant leadership served as an inspiration to many. New Orleans and the rest of the world has lost a legend. I am saddened by her loss and send my condolences to her family in need of solace at this time. https://t.co/gpbdAxvuMb
Happy #HispanicHeritageMonth to all those celebrating in my district and across the country. Thank you for your immeasurable contributions!
Thank you, Steny! https://t.co/U28V02FnZ1
Thank you! https://t.co/LAAtTGJVo2
Let us pay tribute to the lives of innocent victims and loved ones lost 18 years ago today on September 11th. May we #NeverForget their heroism in the face of hate.

I’ve been concerned about Yoel Alonso Leal’s treatment and have also been in contact with ICE about his case. After speaking with ICE leadership, he unfortunately still remains in custody. I will continue working with my colleagues to advocate for the freedom Yoel deserves.

On #LaborDay today, we recognize the tenacity and tireless organizing of American workers whose efforts have built and sustained our country’s workforce. Thank you for your continued contributions to society.
Congratulations to Louisiana’s own for their Little League World Series victory! You make us so proud. We will be rooting for you this weekend as you take on Hawaii. #LLWS https://t.co/1BB7bbsir7

Governor Kathleen Blanco was a peaceful warrior who will be remembered as a champion for all Louisianans. I send my deepest condolences to the Blanco family during this difficult time. May her soul Rest In Peace.

What happened in El Paso today has got to stop. Mass shootings should have no place in American society. I send my strength and condolences to all of the families and friends connected to the innocent lives that were lost.
Every American deserves to know the criminality and corruption exposed in the #MuellerReport. #RetweetTheReport
